subject: Relationships
title: The Invention of Valentine's Day
description: A fast breakdown of The Invention of Valentine's Day for builders.

hook.text: Valentine's Day has almost nothing to do with St. Valentine. The holiday was invented by a poet in 1375.

buildup.text: Chaucer wrote a poem linking February 14 to romantic love. No earlier source connects the date to romance.

discovery.text: By the 1400s, lovers exchanged handwritten notes on February 14. The tradition exploded across Europe.

twist.text: The original St. Valentine was executed by Rome. His feast day was about martyrdom, not candy hearts.

climax.text: A poet turned a saint's death anniversary into the world's biggest celebration of love. Words are powerful.

punchline.text: Valentine's Day was invented by a poet, not a saint.

quiz.question: Who first linked February 14 to romantic love?
